author: Chris kitching
title: Uncle gives chilling statement to murder detectives days after killing five family members
text:
News Uncle gives chilling statement to murder detectives days after killing five family members WARNING: GRAPHIC CONTENT: Robert Xie spoke to police two years before he was charged, telling detectives about the moment he and his wife discovered the bodies Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Unsettling police footage of Robert Xie Share this video Get   
A man convicted of killing five family members - including two nephews as young as nine - gave a chilling statement to police just days after the brutal massacre. 
Robert Xie, 53, was first interviewed by detectives two years before he was charged with the murders of his brother-in-law's family. 
Xie told police that he tried to stop his wife Kathy from entering parts of her brother's blood-spattered home after they discovered the victims' bodies. 
In the recorded interview he told detectives that he was "frightened" by the house of horrors, where the victims were bludgeoned to death with a hammer-like object. Robert Xie is escorted after being found guilty (Photo: AAP) Relatives hold portraits of the victims (Photo: AAP) Blood splattered on a wall inside the victims' home (Photo: NSW Supreme Court) 
Footage of the interview from July 2009 was released after Xie was found guilty in January following a lengthy investigation and multiple trials . Read More 
Xie told police: "[I] tried to stop kathy to look at this thing. I don’t want kathy to look at certain things. 
"Yeah, that’s why i won’t. 
"It’s scary, it was scary. It frightened me." Blood found at the crime scene (Photo: NSW Supreme Court) The family members were killed in their home in July 2009 (Photo: NSW Supreme Court) 
Last week Xie received five consecutive life sentences with no chance of parole for killing his brother-in-law Min Lin, 45, his wife Lily, 43, Lily's sister Irene, 39, and his nephews Henry, 12, and Terry, 9, in their bedrooms at their home north of Sydney, Australia. 
The adults had been killed in their beds while they slept after the electricity to the home had been deliberately cut by the killer. 
Prosecutors claimed that Xie carried out the killings because he was angry over his lowly status in the family and he was obsessed with his teenage niece. Terry, 9, would occasionally sleep in this bed in his parents' room (Photo: NSW Supreme Court) Read More E-fit as cops try to solve riddle of man found dead in a field with only suitcase and book on theology 
She was away on a school trip at the time of the murders and moved in with Xie and his wife after the killings. 
Xie, who denied murder, was initially charged in May 2011 and convicted by a jury in January following a fourth trial. 
After the sentencing hearing Xie's wife claimed he was set up by police and is innocent. She said he would appeal the conviction. Like us on Facebook
